p: One of the fundamental plant ecological strategy axes with ramifications for dispersal capacity is the trade-off between seed mass and seed number [ 27– 30]. Plants can either direct their reproductive investment into few large seeds or many small seeds [ 31– 33]. Seed mass varies 5 to 6 orders of magnitude between species, even within communities [ 29, 34, 35]. This overdispersion of seed mass in local communities, as opposed to convergence to a single optimum seed mass, suggests that seed mass may be involved in a coexistence mechanism.
